modules.description: Performs VLQ (Variable-Length Quantity) encoding and decoding on integers, using Base64 character encoding. Works directly with `Buffer.t` for output during encoding and `char Stream.t` for input during decoding. Useful for efficiently representing integers in a compact, ASCII-friendly format, such as in source map generation or binary-to-text encoding scenarios.

This module encodes and decodes integers using the Variable-Length Quantity (VLQ) format. It operates on `Buffer.t` for encoding and `char Stream.t` for decoding. It is suitable for efficiently serializing integers in formats like source map mappings where compact representation is critical.

This module encodes and decodes variable-length integers (VLQ) to and from byte buffers, supporting both signed and unsigned values using efficient `Bigstring.t` operations. It includes submodules that handle VLQ encoding with Base64 characters to and from `Buffer.t` and `char Stream.t`, enabling compact, ASCII-friendly representations. Main operations allow reading and writing integers in VLQ format, with specific applications in source map generation and binary serialization. Examples include encoding a sequence of integers into a Base64 VLQ string or decoding such a stream into original integer values.
